definition: name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Duck-foot Health and the Yangtze River, were really the match.
sentences.chinese: 鴨腳生江南，名實本相符。

sentences.english: Carrying on a research to it, we must investigate the name and the material object together, and clarify the source and course.
sentences.chinese: 對之進行研究，必須名實同步考察，源流一併弄清。

sentences.english: I was surprised that he gave his real name to a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 他向陌生人吐露真名實姓，使我感到很喫驚。

sentences.english: In the old acquaintance-society, the term"mediation"is not in consistent with its essence.
sentences.chinese: 在熟人社會，調解是名實分離的。

sentences.english: The debate on linguistics before Qin Dynasty began with the concept on existence and consciousness in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 先秦語言學的討論是從哲學上的名實之辯興起的。

sentences.english: Flash still has no equal to its interactivity.
sentences.chinese: Flash還是沒有在交互性上名實相符。

sentences.english: Zhuhai Mingshi Ceramics Valve Co. , Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 珠海市名實陶瓷閥有限公司。

sentences.english: Underwriting must once again deserve the name.
sentences.chinese: 保險業必須重新名實相符。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
